selected_quotes: Ancient feathers - Brazil yields 120 million year old bird from Dinosaur Age - NComms -
Juvenile enantiornithine from the Crato with preserved feathers: #birds #dinosaurs
New #OA paper on a Cretaceous #bird: A Mesozoic bird from Gondwana preserving feathers #dinosaurs #fossils
Pequeña ave con dientes y plumas preservadas en Brasil: A Mesozoic bird from Gondwana preserving feathers

citation.abstract: The fossil record of birds in the Mesozoic of Gondwana is mostly based on isolated and often poorly preserved specimens, none of which has preserved details on feather anatomy. We provide the description of a fossil bird represented by a skeleton with feathers from the Early Cretaceous of Gondwana (NE Brazil). The specimen sheds light on the homology and 3D structure of the rachis-dominated feathers, previously known from two-dimensional slabs. The rectrices exhibit a row of rounded spots, probably corresponding to some original colour pattern. The specimen supports the identification of the feather scapus as the rachis, which is notably robust and elliptical in cross-section. In spite of its juvenile nature, the tail plumage resembles the feathering of adult individuals of modern birds. Documentation of rachis-dominated tail in South American enantiornithines broadens the paleobiogeographic distribution of basal birds with this tail feather morphotype, up to now only reported from China.
citation.title: A Mesozoic bird from Gondwana preserving feathers

news.title: Mezozoiczny ptak ze wstążkowatymi piórami w ogonie
news.summary: W 2011 r. w basenie Araripe odkryto skamieniałość ptaka wielkości kolibra ze wstążkowatymi piórami ogona. To pierwsza taka skamieniałość z Ameryki Południowej i jedna z najstarszych ptasich skamieniałości z Gondwany.

news.title: Hallan fósil de un ave de 115 millones de años en Brasil
news.summary: Los científicos aseguran que este descubrimiento cambiará la forma de entender ese tipo de restos fósiles

news.title: First-of-its-kind bird fossil found in Brazil
news.summary: It dates back approximately 115 million years and reveals a prehistoric bird with long tail feathers, a first-of-its-kind find for South America.

news.title: Video: First 3-D bird fossil of South America discovered in Brazil
news.summary: Reconstruction of the Cretaceous fossil bird from the Araripe Basin, Brazil. Illustration by Deverson Pepi Archaeologists have stumbled upon a bird fossil that is so well preserved its long tail feathers have possibly retained their original color and spot

news.title: Seltenes Vogelfossil: Der Winzling vom Superkontinent Gondwana
news.summary: Er lebte auf dem ehemaligen Superkontinent Gondwana und war in etwa so groß wie ein Kolibri: In Brasilien haben Forscher ein 115 Millionen Jahre altes Vogelfossil entdeckt. Es ist das erste seiner Art aus der Region.

news.title: Fóssil de ave com longas penas coloridas descoberto pela primeira vez no Brasil
news.summary: O fóssil muito bem conservado de uma pequena ave hoje extinta que data do Cretácico Inferior, a Idade de Ouro dos dinossauros, permite perceber melhor a evolução das penas das aves.

news.title: Fogakkal is rendelkezett a kolibri méretű ősmadár
news.summary: Apró, kolibri méretű, 115 millió évvel ezelőtt élt ősmadár maradványaira bukkantak szakértők Brazíliában.

news.title: Flashy-tailed bird fossil first of its kind in Brazil
news.summary: With ribbonlike plumage modern birds can only dream of, the 115-million-year-old find is unique in that part of the world

news.title: Prehistoric Bird Sported Feather 'Arrows' On Its Butt (VIDEO, PHOTOS)
news.summary: Dinosaurs are usually thought of as scaly or with tough, rhino-like skin, but bird fossils found in northeast Brazil indicate that at least one type of "dinobird" had very fancy feathers.

news.title: Vom Superkontinent Gondwana - Seltener Südamerika-Fund: Forscher finden Vogelzwerg mit Band-Federn
news.summary: Winzig und bunt - ein in Brasilien entdeckter Vogelwinzling dürfte sehr hübsch gewesen sein. Der fossile Zwerg hat ungefähr vor 115 Millionen Jahren gelebt. Aber es ist nicht nur das Alter, dass den seltenen Fund in Südamerika bedeutend macht.

news.title: Hallan en Brasil fósil de ave de la época de los dinosaurios [con vídeo]
news.summary: Con una peculiar cola de plumas, este es el fósil de ave del cretácico más completo hallado hasta ahora en la zona que fue Gondwana. -- Lea más sobre ScientificAmerican.com/espanol

news.title: 115-Million-Year-Old Bird Fossil Found in Brazil
news.summary: The well-preserved fossil of a previously unknown toothed bird that lived during the Cretaceous period, some 115 million years ago, has been found in the northeastern Brazilian state of Ceará. A team of paleontologists led by Dr Ismar de Souza Carvalho of

news.title: Ancient Bird From Age Of Dinosaurs Could Explain Mysteries Of Evolution
news.summary: A fossil of an ancient bird shows detail in the wings of an animal that flew 115 million years before our time. What can this artifact tell us about the evolution of birds?

news.title: Un oiseau fossile du Gondwana nous montre son plumage
news.summary: Au Brésil, le fossile d’un oiseau vieux de 115 millions d’années exhibe de si beaux restes de plumage que les chercheurs ont pu en retrouver la forme et la structure. Les plumes ne pouvaient lui servir à voler, affirment-ils. Cet énantiornithe, une famille

news.title: Le fossile d'un oiseau vieux de 115 millions d'années découvert au Brésil
news.summary: Au Brésil, des chercheurs brésiliens ont mis la main sur un oiseau âgé de 115 millions d'années avec ses plumes et en trois dimensions. C'est l'un des plus vieux oiseaux jamais découvert.

news.title: Prehistoric bird had bizarre tail, say scientists
news.summary: Some 115 million years ago, on the ancient continent of Gondwana, lived a bird with a ribbonlike tail not seen in modern birds.

news.title: Bird with Flashy Tail Was 1st of its Kind on Ancient Supercontinent
news.summary: About 115 million years ago, a teenage bird with spotted, ribbonlike tail feathers flew around the trees of the supercontinent Gondwana, until it perished and fossilized in what is now northeastern Brazil, a new study finds. At 5.5 inches (14 centimeters)

news.title: Smuk forhistorisk fugl fundet i Brasilien
news.summary: For 115 millioner år siden fløj en forhistorisk fugl med flade, bånd-lignende halefjer rundt på det sydlige superkontinent Gondwana. Tidligere har forskerne troet, at de for længst uddøde fuglearter kun fandtes på den nordlige halvkugle. For 115 millioner

news.title: Hallan conservadas en ámbar las alas de un ave de la época de los dinosaurios
news.summary: El color y la disposición de las plumas de hace 99 millones de años se aprecian con gran detalle y son muy parecidos a los actuales Ilustración de un ejemplar con el ala atrapada en la resina del árbol - Chung-tat Cheung Un equipo de investigadores…

news.title: Hallan conservadas en ámbar las alas de un ave de la época de los dinosaurios
news.summary: Un equipo de investigadores de la Universidad de Geociencias de China en Pekín ha descubierto en el noreste de Myanmar dos pequeñas alas atrapadas en ámbar hace 99 millones de años, en mitad del período Cretácico, cuando los dinosaurios todavía…

news.title: Hallan conservadas en ámbar las alas de un ave de la época de los dinosaurios
news.summary: Los restos parciales de las alas están encerradas en unos pocos centímetros cúbicos de ámbar.

Nós temos os fósseis...

O fóssil da ave mais antiga do Brasil e da América do Sul foi encontrado na Chapada do Araripe no Ceará. Esse belo exemplar chama atenção pela sua preservação excepcional, apresentando as penas da cauda contendo inclusive vestígios
